DataElement.preferredName: Investigational Entity Allocation Administration Performed Study Activity Delay Duration ISO21090.PQ.TIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action that is the assignment of an experimental unit to a portion of the study, such as an arm or a portion of an arm (when secondary allocations may occur). EXAMPLE(S): Mrs. Smith is assigned to Arm A. The period of time that an action is delayed relative to an original schedule. EXAMPLE(S): If a substance administration is delayed 2 days as a result of an adverse event, then the delay duration is 2 days.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigational Entity Allocation Administration Performed Study Activity Delay Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: In the process of being studied; experimental.:An independently existing thing (living or nonliving).:The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.:The period of time during which something continues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains PQ to have units that describe a period of time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
